contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Metrication-US-logo.png|thumb|Board Logo]] The '''United States Metric Board''' was a [[United States government]] agency set up to encourage [[metrication]]. It existed from 1975 to 1982, ending when President [[Ronald Reagan]] abolished it, largely on the recommendation of [[Frank Mankiewicz]] and [[Lyn Nofziger]]. Overall, it made little impact on implementing the [[Metrication in the United States|metric system in the United States]]. ==External links== *[http://lamar.colostate.edu/~hillger/laws/usmb.html History of the US Metric Board] [[Category:1975 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:1982 disestablishments in the United States]] [[Category:Defunct agencies of the United States government|Metric Board]] [[Category:Metrication in the United States]] {{US-gov-stub}}
